definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: Sometimes salesmen need to do a lot of fast talking to convince clients to buy.
sentences.chinese: 有時候業務員需要快言快語去說服客戶購買。

sentences.english: Im a foreign trade worker of the China National Textiles Import and Export Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 我是中國紡織品進出口公司的業務員。

sentences.english: Wei, the furniture salesman, said he can wait.
sentences.chinese: 魏，前面提到的傢俱業務員，說他願意等。

sentences.english: 500 salesmen came to listen to his speech.
Wang Ling, a salesman, calls to speak to Mr. Black, the manager of the Wright Company.
sentences.chinese: 銷售業務員王凌打電話找萊特公司經理布萊克先生。

sentences.english: I just don't trust door-to-door salesmen.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不相信逐戶推銷的業務員。

sentences.english: A brokerage yuppie no longer, Wu Hsin-hui now works happily in insurance.
sentences.chinese: 不做號子英雄，吳心慧是個快樂的保險業務員。

definition: main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
